premises: If a substance loses electrons, it is oxidized
If a substance gains electrons, it is reduced
conclusions: If a substance is not oxidized, then it does not lose electrons
If a substance is not reduced, then it does not gain electrons
If a substance is not reduced, then it is oxidized
A substance is either oxidized or reduced
If a substance gains electrons and loses electrons, then it is reduced
incorrect conclusions: If a substance is oxidized, then it loses electrons
If a substance is oxidized, then it does not lose electrons
If a substance is not oxidized, then it does not gain electrons
A substance is both oxidized and reduced
If a substance is reduced, then it gains electrons
If a substance is reduced and oxidized, then it gains electrons

premises: If a compound is ionic, it conducts electricity in solution
If a compound is covalent, it does not conduct electricity in solution
conclusions: If a compound does not conduct electricity in solution, then it is not ionic
If a compound conducts electricity in solution, then it is not covalent
If a compound conducts electricity in solution, then it is ionic
A compound is either ionic or covalent
If a compound conducts electricity in solution and is ionic, then it conducts electricity in solution
incorrect conclusions: If a compound conducts electricity in solution, then it is ionic
If a compound conducts electricity in solution, then it is not ionic
If a compound does not conduct electricity in solution, then it is not covalent
A compound is both ionic and covalent
If a compound does not conduct electricity in solution, then it does not conduct electricity in solution
If a compound is ionic and covalent, then it does not conduct electricity in solution

premises: If a reaction is exothermic, it releases heat
If a reaction is endothermic, it absorbs heat
conclusions: If a reaction does not release heat, then it is not exothermic
If a reaction does not absorb heat, then it is not endothermic
If a reaction does not absorb heat, then it releases heat
A reaction is either exothermic or endothermic
If a reaction releases heat and is exothermic, then it absorbs heat
incorrect conclusions: If a reaction releases heat, then it is exothermic
If a reaction releases heat, then it is not exothermic
If a reaction does not release heat, then it does not absorb heat
A reaction is both exothermic and endothermic
If a reaction absorbs heat, then it absorbs heat
If a reaction is exothermic and endothermic, then it absorbs heat
